availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles G. Rule (Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Johnson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Priscilla Turner Rule on October 23, 1851. Father of Millard F. Rule, Laura J. Rule, and Mary Rule. Second lieutenant in the 65th Regiment of Kentucky Militia in 1864.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, p. 81; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Johnson County, Barretts Creek Precinct, p. 13; Kentucky, County Marriages â€“ Microfilm (1783-1965), Roll #001912950, Johnson County Marriages, p. 45; KYR-0002-022-0076; KYR-0002-022-0077; Find A Grave, "Charles Greenville Rule (1832-)," Memorial #159446361, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=159446361&ref=acom (accessed May 18, 2017).
